definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: In my opinion, China must depend on intensive cultivation to feed itself.
sentences.chinese: 我看中国就是靠精耕细作吃饭。

sentences.english: We saw new factories and well-cultivated fields all along the line.
sentences.chinese: 铁路沿线到处可见新建的工厂和精耕细作的田地。

sentences.english: Chaoshan farmers to intensive famous, such as embroidery farming to speak of.
sentences.chinese: 潮汕农民以精耕细作闻名，有种田如绣花之说。

sentences.english: To make up for the lack of land, he proposed intensive cultivation of the fields.
sentences.chinese: 为了弥补土地不足，他建议精耕细作。

definition: deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
plowing and weeding/farm work/fig. to work or study diligently
rushing to stake one's claim in new markets
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
to make industrious and diligent efforts (idiom)
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to take root/to establish a base
